result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Torri Francesca Pike

records.addlTxt:
10:30 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Torri Francesca Pike in court.  Attorney A.W. Schutte in court for Torri Francesca Pike.  Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews file and notes before calling the case DE states she would like to waive prelim. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Parties have an agreement and would like to proceed to pleas.  Court plans to schedule that for a different date.  DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 10:41 AM. bph
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 30, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Filed by DA's Office. km

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- Defendant to take medications as prescribed.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Dale D.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

- If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:05 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Torri Francesca Pike in court.  Attorney Brian Thomas Smestad and intern Allison Casey in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Torri Francesca Pike. DE does not qualify for PD. DE confirms address.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  Bond argument.  PFAC given.
